comments: Also convolution of A000984 with A040075, also convolution of A000302 with A020920, also convolution of A002457 with A038846, also convolution of A002697 with A020918, also convolution of A002802 with A038845. [_Rui Duarte_, Oct 08 2011]
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
formula: a(n) = binomial(n+5, 5)*A000984(n+5)/A000984(5), where A000984 are central binomial coefficients. - _Wolfdieter Lang_a(n) = ((2n+9)(2n+7)(2n+5)(2n+3)(2n+1)/(9*7*5*3*1)) * binomial(2n, n), a(n) = binomial(2n+10, 10) * binomial(2n, n) / binomial(n+5, 5), a(n) = binomial(n+5, 5) * binomial(2n+10, n+5) / binomial(10, 5), a(n) = sum( i_1+i_2+i_3+i_4+i_5+i_6+i_7+i_8+i_9+i_10+i_11=n, f(i_1)*f(i_2)*f(i_3)*f(i_4)*f(i_5)*f(i_6)*f(i_7)*f(i_8)*f(i_9)*f(i_10)*f(i_11)) with f(k)=A000984(k). [_Rui Duarte_, Oct 08 2011]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
